q: I am a system that uses sensors, microprocessors, and actuators to work without human intervention. What am I?
a: An Automated System.

q: What is the role of a Sensor in an automated system?
a: To measure physical quantities (like temperature, light, pressure) and send data to the microprocessor.

q: What is the role of a Microprocessor in an automated system?
a: To process data from sensors, compare it to stored values, and send signals to actuators.

q: What is the role of an Actuator in an automated system?
a: To receive signals from the microprocessor and control a mechanism (e.g., turn on a motor, open a valve).

q: Give an example of an automated system in a car.
a: Adaptive Cruise Control, Self-Parking System, or Automatic Braking.

q: How does Adaptive Cruise Control determine the distance to the car ahead?
a: It uses Laser or Radar sensors to bounce signals off the vehicle in front and calculates distance based on the time taken for the signal to return.

q: I am a machine that can sense my surroundings, move, and complete tasks autonomously. What am I?
a: A Robot.

q: What are the three main characteristics of a robot?
a: 1. Ability to sense surroundings. 2. Ability to move. 3. Programmable to complete tasks.

q: Give two advantages of using robots in manufacturing.
a: They can work 24/7 without rest, are more precise/consistent, and can work in dangerous environments.

q: Give two disadvantages of using robots in manufacturing.
a: High initial cost to set up, and they can lead to unemployment for human workers.

q: What is Artificial Intelligence (AI)?
a: Computer systems that can simulate human intelligence (e.g., reasoning, learning, problem-solving).

q: I am a type of AI that mimics the decision-making ability of a human expert. What am I?
a: An Expert System.

q: Scenario: A doctor uses a computer program to help diagnose a rare disease. What type of AI is this?
a: An Expert System.

q: What are the three main components of an Expert System?
a: Knowledge Base, Inference Engine, and User Interface.

q: What is the function of the Inference Engine?
a: It applies rules to the knowledge base and user input to make decisions or predictions.

q: What is Machine Learning?
a: A subset of AI where computers learn from data and improve their performance without being explicitly programmed for every rule.

q: Give an example of Machine Learning in daily life.
a: Email spam filters, product recommendations (Netflix/Amazon), or voice assistants (Siri/Alexa).

q: What is the difference between Narrow AI and General AI?
a: Narrow AI is good at one specific task (e.g., playing chess). General AI can perform any intellectual task a human can do.

q: I am a sensor used to detect if a door is open or closed. What am I?
a: Magnetic Field Sensor (or Proximity Sensor).

q: I am a sensor used to measure the acidity of a liquid. What am I?
a: pH Sensor.

q: I am a sensor used to measure wind speed. What am I?
a: An Anemometer.

q: I am a sensor used in game controllers to detect tilting or motion. What am I?
a: An Accelerometer.

q: In a greenhouse, what actuator would be used if the temperature is too high?
a: A motor to open a window or a fan to cool the air.

q: Why use automated systems in a nuclear power station?
a: To ensure safety by keeping humans away from radiation and to react faster than humans to dangerous changes.

q: How does an automated irrigation system save water?
a: It uses soil moisture sensors to only water the crops when absolutely necessary, preventing waste.

q: What is a Chatbot?
a: A computer program designed to simulate conversation with human users, often using AI.
